intro: Melothria rumphiana, commonly known as the sour sop or custard apple, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically pear-shaped with a rough, yellowish-green skin. Inside, the fruit contains a soft, creamy flesh with a distinctive sour-sweet flavor. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
